analyzed: yathā tam sutavatā sāvakena sammat eva satthu sāsanam ājānantena evam evam bhadantena tapassinā samaṇassa gotamassa byākata
translated: Just as a well-taught disciple of mine would understand it, so has the venerable Dīghatapassī explained it.

original: Kiñhi sobhati chavo manodaṇḍo imassa evaṁ oḷārikassa kāyadaṇḍassa upanidhāya.
analyzed: kiñhi sobhati chavaḥ manaḥ daṇḍaḥ imassa evam oḷārikassa kāya daṇḍassa upanidhāya
translated: For how could the slight mental rod compare with the gross bodily rod?

original: Atha kho kāyadaṇḍova mahāsāvajjataro pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyā, no tathā vacīdaṇḍo, no tathā manodaṇḍo.🔽Handa cāhaṁ, bhante, gacchāmi samaṇassa gotamassa imasmiṁ kathāvatthusmiṁ vādaṁ āropessāmi.
analyzed: atha kho kāya daṇḍaḥ uva mahāsā ajjataro pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyā no tathā vacī daṇḍaḥ no tathā manaḥ daṇḍaḥ  handa ca āha bhante gacchāmi samaṇassa gotamassa imasmin kathā vatthusmin vādam āropessāmi
translated: But bodily action is more reprehensible than verbal action, and mental action is more reprehensible than bodily action.🔽Well then, venerable sir, I shall go and challenge the recluse Gotama’s doctrine to his face with its denial of the efficacy of sacrifices and offerings.

original: Sace me samaṇo gotamo tathā patiṭṭhahissati yathā bhadantena tapassinā patiṭṭhāpitaṁ;
analyzed: sace me samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tathā patiṭṭhahissati yathā bhadantena tapassinā patiṭṭhāpita
translated: If the recluse Gotama will stand firm on this assertion of his,🔽just as the venerable ascetic Tapassu has stood firm on his,

original: seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso dīghalomikaṁ eḷakaṁ lomesu gahetvā ākaḍḍheyya parikaḍḍheyya
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma balavā purisaḥ dīghalomikam eḷakam lomesu gahetvā ākaḍḍheyya parikaḍḍheyya
translated: then just as a strong man might seize a weaker man by the head or shoulders and drag him around and push him around,

original: samparikaḍḍheyya; evamevāhaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ vādena vādaṁ ākaḍḍhissāmi parikaḍḍhissāmi samparikaḍḍhissāmi.
analyzed: samparikaḍḍheyya evam eva aham samaṇam gotamam vādena vādam ākaḍḍhissāmi parikaḍḍhissāmi samparikaḍḍhissāmi
translated: so in the same way I will drag around and push around the recluse Gotama with his doctrine of the denial of sacrifices and offerings.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma balavā soṇḍikākammakāro mahantaṁ soṇḍikākilañjaṁ gambhīre udakarahade🔽pakkhipitvā kaṇṇe gahetvā ākaḍḍheyya parikaḍḍheyya samparikaḍḍheyya; evamevāhaṁ samaṇaṁ
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma balavā soṇḍikā kammakāraḥ mahantam soṇḍikā kilañjam gambhīre udaka rahade 🔽pakkhipitvā kaṇṇe gahetvā ākaḍḍheyya parikaḍḍheyya samparikaḍḍheyya evam eva aham samaṇa
translated: Just as a strong potter might drag around and push around a weak potter,🔽so in the same way I will drag around and push around the recluse Gotama with his doctrine of the denial of sacrifices and offerings.

original: gotamaṁ vādena vādaṁ ākaḍḍhissāmi parikaḍḍhissāmi samparikaḍḍhissāmi.🔽Seyyathāpi nāma balavā soṇḍikādhutto vālaṁ kaṇṇe gahetvā odhuneyya niddhuneyya nipphoṭeyya; evamevāhaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ vādena vādaṁ odhunissāmi niddhunissāmi nipphoṭessāmi.
analyzed: gotamam vādena vādam ākaḍḍhissāmi parikaḍḍhissāmi samparikaḍḍhissāmi  sa iyyathā api nāma balavā soṇḍikādhuttaḥ vālam kaṇṇe gahetvā odhuneyya niddhuneyya nipphoṭeyya evam eva aham samaṇam gotamam vādena vādam odhunissāmi niddhunissāmi nipphoṭessāmi
translated: I’ll pull him around and drag him around and toss him around in the debate.🔽Just as a powerful wrestler grabs a weaker wrestler by the head or shoulders and pulls him around and drags him around and tosses him around, in the same way I’ll pull the contemplative Gotama around and drag him around and toss him around in the debate.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma kuñjaro saṭṭhihāyano gambhīraṁ pokkharaṇiṁ ogāhetvā sāṇadhovikaṁ nāma kīḷitajātaṁ kīḷati; evamevāhaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ sāṇadhovikaṁ maññe kīḷitajātaṁ kīḷissāmi.
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma kuñjaraḥ saṭṭhihāyanaḥ gambhīram pokkharaṇim ogāhetvā sāṇadhovikam nāma kīḷita jātam kīḷati evam eva aham samaṇam gotamam sāṇadhovikam maññe kīḷita jātam kīḷissāmi
translated: Just as an elephant with sixty tusks plunges into a deep lake and plays the game called ‘washing the tusk’, in the same way I’ll play the game called ‘washing the tusk’ with the contemplative Gotama.

original: Handa cāhaṁ, bhante, gacchāmi samaṇassa gotamassa imasmiṁ kathāvatthusmiṁ vādaṁ āropessāmī”ti.
analyzed: handa ca āha bhante gacchāmi samaṇassa gotamassa imasmin kathā vatthusmin vādam āropessāmi iti
translated: So, sir, I’ll go and lay a wager with the contemplative Gotama on this topic for discussion.”

original: “Gaccha tvaṁ, gahapati, samaṇassa gotamassa imasmiṁ kathāvatthusmiṁ vādaṁ āropehi.
analyzed: gaccha tva gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa imasmin kathā vatthusmin vādam āropehi
translated: “Go, householder, and lay a wager with the contemplative Gotama on this topic for discussion.

original: Ahaṁ vā hi, gahapati, samaṇassa gotamassa vādaṁ āropeyyaṁ, dīghatapassī vā nigaṇṭho, tvaṁ vā”ti.
analyzed: aham vā hi gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa vādam āropeyya dīghatapassī vā nigaṇṭhaḥ tvam vāti
translated: Either I or Dīghatapassī or you should lay a wager with the contemplative Gotama on this topic for discussion.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, dīghatapassī nigaṇṭho nigaṇṭhaṁ nāṭaputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte dīghatapassī nigaṇṭhaḥ nigaṇṭham nāṭa puttam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the Nigaṇṭha Dīghanakha told the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta:

original: “na kho metaṁ, bhante, ruccati yaṁ upāli gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa vādaṁ āropeyya.
analyzed: na kho mā ita bhante ruccati yam upāli gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa vādam āropeyya
translated: “Venerable sir, I don’t approve of the householder Upāli’s going to the recluse Gotama’s doctrine and discipline for refuge.

original: Samaṇo hi, bhante, gotamo māyāvī āvaṭṭaniṁ māyaṁ jānāti yāya aññatitthiyānaṁ sāvake āvaṭṭetī”ti.🔽“Aṭṭhānaṁ kho etaṁ, tapassi, anavakāso yaṁ upāli gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakattaṁ upagaccheyya.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ hi bhante gotamaḥ māyāvī āvaṭṭanim mā ayam jānāti yāya añña titthiyānam sāvake āvaṭṭeti iti  aṭṭhānam kho eta tapassi anavakāsaḥ yam upāli gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa sāvaka ttam upagaccheyya
translated: For the recluse Gotama is a magician and knows a converting magic by which he converts disciples of other sectarians.”🔽“It is impossible, Dīghanakha, it cannot happen that the householder Upāli should go to the recluse Gotama’s doctrine and discipline for refuge.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ vijjati yaṁ samaṇo gotamo upālissa gahapatissa sāvakattaṁ upagaccheyya.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho etam vijjati yam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ upālissa gahapatissa sāvaka ttam upagaccheyya
translated: But it is possible that the recluse Gotama might go to the householder Upāli’s refuge.

original: Gaccha tvaṁ, gahapati, samaṇassa gotamassa imasmiṁ kathāvatthusmiṁ vādaṁ āropehi.
analyzed: gaccha tva gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa imasmin kathā vatthusmin vādam āropehi
translated: Go, householder, and refute the recluse Gotama’s doctrine.

original: Ahaṁ vā hi, gahapati, samaṇassa gotamassa vādaṁ āropeyyaṁ, dīghatapassī vā nigaṇṭho, tvaṁ vā”ti.
analyzed: aham vā hi gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa vādam āropeyya dīghatapassī vā nigaṇṭhaḥ tvam vāti
translated: Either I will refute the recluse Gotama’s doctrine for you, or you will do so for me.”🔽A second time…

original: Dutiyampi kho dīghatapassī …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho dīgha tapassī pe
translated: A second time …🔽

original: tatiyampi kho dīghatapassī nigaṇṭho nigaṇṭhaṁ nāṭaputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho dīghatapassī nigaṇṭhaḥ nigaṇṭham nāṭa puttam etat avoca
translated: For a third time, Dīghatapassī said the same thing,

original: “na kho metaṁ, bhante, ruccati yaṁ upāli gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa vādaṁ āropeyya.
analyzed: na kho mā ita bhante ruccati yam upāli gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa vādam āropeyya
translated: “Venerable sir, I don’t like it that the householder Upāli would dispute the doctrine with the ascetic Gotama.

original: Samaṇo hi, bhante, gotamo māyāvī āvaṭṭaniṁ māyaṁ jānāti yāya aññatitthiyānaṁ sāvake āvaṭṭetī”ti.🔽“Aṭṭhānaṁ kho etaṁ, tapassi, anavakāso yaṁ upāli gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakattaṁ upagaccheyya.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ hi bhante gotamaḥ māyāvī āvaṭṭanim mā ayam jānāti yāya añña titthiyānam sāvake āvaṭṭeti iti  aṭṭhānam kho eta tapassi anavakāsaḥ yam upāli gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa sāvaka ttam upagaccheyya
translated: For the ascetic Gotama is a magician and knows a spell by which he bewitches the disciples of others.”🔽“It’s impossible, Tapassi, it cannot happen that the householder Upāli would go forth into homelessness in the presence of the ascetic Gotama.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ vijjati yaṁ samaṇo gotamo upālissa gahapatissa sāvakattaṁ upagaccheyya.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho etam vijjati yam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ upālissa gahapatissa sāvaka ttam upagaccheyya
translated: But it’s possible that the ascetic Gotama would go forth into homelessness in the presence of the householder Upāli.

original: Gaccha tvaṁ, gahapati, samaṇassa gotamassa imasmiṁ kathāvatthusmiṁ vādaṁ āropehi.
analyzed: gaccha tva gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa imasmin kathā vatthusmin vādam āropehi
translated: Go, householder, and dispute the doctrine with the ascetic Gotama on this topic.

original: Ahaṁ vā hi, gahapati, samaṇassa gotamassa vādaṁ āropeyyaṁ, dīghatapassī vā nigaṇṭho, tvaṁ vā”ti.
analyzed: aham vā hi gahapati samaṇassa gotamassa vādam āropeyya dīghatapassī vā nigaṇṭhaḥ tvam vāti
translated: Either I or Dīghatapassī or you should dispute the doctrine with the ascetic Gotama.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho upāli gahapati nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa paṭissutvā uṭṭhāyāsanā🔽nigaṇṭhaṁ nāṭaputtaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā yena pāvārikambavanaṁ yena bhagavā🔽tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho upāli gahapati nigaṇṭhassa nāṭa puttassa paṭissutvā uṭṭhāya āsanā  nigaṇṭham nāṭa puttam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā yena pāvārikambavanam yena bhagavā  tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamanta
translated: “Yes, sir,” Upāli replied. He got up from his seat,

original: nisinno kho upāli gahapati bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: nisinnaḥ khalu upāli gahapati bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: bowed down, circumambulated the Nigaṇṭha with his right side toward him, and then went to the Pāvārika’s Mango Grove, to the Buddha, and bowed down to him. He then sat down and told the Buddha all that had happened.

original: “āgamā nu khvidha, bhante, dīghatapassī nigaṇṭho”ti?
analyzed: nu khvidha bhante dīghatapassī nigaṇṭhā iti
translated: “Venerable Sir, has the Nigaṇṭha Dīghatapassī come here?”

original: “Āgamā khvidha, gahapati, dīghatapassī nigaṇṭho”ti.
analyzed: āgamā khvidha gahapati dīghatapassī nigaṇṭhā iti
translated: “Yes, he has.”

original: “Ahu kho pana te, bhante, dīghatapassinā nigaṇṭhena saddhiṁ kocideva kathāsallāpo”ti?
analyzed: ahu kho pana te bhante dīghatapassinā nigaṇṭhena saddhim kocid eva kathā sallāpā iti
translated: “Did you have some conversation with him?”

original: “Ahu kho me, gahapati, dīghatapassinā nigaṇṭhena saddhiṁ kocideva kathāsallāpo”ti.
analyzed: ahu kho me gahapati dīghatapassinā nigaṇṭhena saddhim kocid eva kathā sallāpā uti
translated: “Yes, I did.”

original: “Yathā kathaṁ pana te, bhante, ahu dīghatapassinā nigaṇṭhena saddhiṁ kocideva kathāsallāpo”ti?
analyzed: yathā katham pana te bhante ahu dīghatapassinā nigaṇṭhena saddhim kocid eva kathā sallāpā uti
translated: “But what was your conversation with him like?”

original: Atha kho bhagavā yāvatako ahosi dīghatapassinā nigaṇṭhena saddhiṁ kathāsallāpo taṁ sabbaṁ upālissa gahapatissa ārocesi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā yāvatakaḥ ahosi dīghatapassinā nigaṇṭhena saddhim kathā sallāpo tam sabbam upālissa gahapatissa ārocesi
translated: Then the Buddha told Upāli everything that had happened in his conversation with Digha Tapassi.

original: Evaṁ vutte, upāli gahapati bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte upāli gahapati bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Upāli said to the Buddha,

original: “sādhu sādhu, bhante tapassī.
analyzed: sādhu sādhu bhante tapassī
translated: “Excellent, lord! Excellent!🔽Just as if he were to turn upright what had been overthrown, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms,🔽in the same way has the Blessed One—through many lines of reasoning—made the Dhamma clear.

original: Yathā taṁ sutavatā sāvakena sammadeva satthusāsanaṁ ājānantena evamevaṁ dīghatapassinā nigaṇṭhena bhagavato byākataṁ.🔽Kiñhi sobhati chavo manodaṇḍo imassa evaṁ oḷārikassa kāyadaṇḍassa upanidhāya?
analyzed: yathā tam sutavatā sāvakena sammat eva satthu sāsanam ājānantena evam evam dīghatapassinā nigaṇṭhena bhagavataḥ byākata  kiñhi sobhati chavaḥ manaḥ daṇḍaḥ imassa evam oḷārikassa kāya daṇḍassa upanidhāya
translated: I go to the Blessed One for refuge, to the Dhamma, & to the Saṅgha of monks.

original: Atha kho kāyadaṇḍova mahāsāvajjataro pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyā, no tathā vacīdaṇḍo, no tathā manodaṇḍo”ti.
analyzed: atha kho kāya daṇḍaḥ uva mahāsā ajjataro pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyā no tathā vacī daṇḍaḥ no tathā manaḥ daṇḍaḥ iti
translated: May the Blessed One remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”

original: “Sace kho tvaṁ, gahapati, sacce patiṭṭhāya manteyyāsi siyā no ettha kathāsallāpo”ti.
analyzed: sace kho tva gahapati sacce patiṭṭhāya manteyyāsi siyā no ettha kathā sallāpā uti
translated: “If you speak with conviction, householder, there may be a discussion.”

original: “Sacce ahaṁ, bhante, patiṭṭhāya mantessāmi;
analyzed: sacce aha bhante patiṭṭhāya mantessāmi
translated: “I will speak with conviction, lord.

original: hotu no ettha kathāsallāpo”ti.
analyzed: hotu no ettha kathā sallāpo ti
translated: Let there be a discussion.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, gahapati,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi gahapati
translated: “What do you think, householder?

original: idhassa nigaṇṭho ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno sītodakapaṭikkhitto uṇhodakapaṭisevī.
analyzed: nigaṇṭhaḥ ābādhikaḥ dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ sīta udaka paṭikkhittaḥ uṇha udaka paṭisevī
translated: Suppose there was a naked ascetic, sick, suffering, and gravely ill, who needed hot water and was using cold water.

original: So sītodakaṁ alabhamāno kālaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: saḥ sītā udakam a labhamānaḥ kālam kareyya
translated: If he were to die because of that,

original: Imassa pana, gahapati, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto katthūpapattiṁ paññapetī”ti?
analyzed: imassa pana gahapati nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa putto katthu upapattim paññapeti iti
translated: where would the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta declare that he had been reborn?”

original: “Atthi, bhante, manosattā nāma devā tattha so upapajjati”.
analyzed: atthi bhante manosattā nāma devā tattha so upapajjati
translated: “There are gods called ‘mind-bound’; he would be reborn there.”

original: “Taṁ kissa hetu”?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: “What’s the reason?”

original: “Asu hi, bhante, manopaṭibaddho kālaṁ karotī”ti.
analyzed: asu hi bhante mana upaṭibaddhaḥ kālam karoti iti
translated: “Because he died with a mind bound to that.”

original: “Manasi karohi, gahapati, manasi karitvā kho, gahapati, byākarohi.
analyzed: manasi karohi gahapati manasi karitvā khalu gahapati byākarohi
translated: “Pay attention, householder. Having paid attention, answer.

original: Na kho te sandhiyati purimena vā pacchimaṁ, pacchimena vā purimaṁ.
analyzed: na kho te sandhiyati purimena vā pacchima pacchimena vā purima
translated: Your earlier statement doesn’t agree with your later one, and your later statement doesn’t agree with your earlier one.

original: Bhāsitā kho pana te, gahapati, esā vācā:
analyzed: bhāsitā khalu pana te gahapati esā vācā
translated: But you said,

original: ‘sacce ahaṁ, bhante, patiṭṭhāya mantessāmi,
analyzed: sacce aha bhante patiṭṭhāya mantessāmi
translated: ‘If I’m to discuss this matter with you, sir,

original: hotu no ettha kathāsallāpo’”ti.
analyzed: hotu no ettha kathā sallāpo ti
translated: let’s have a discussion.’”

original: “Kiñcāpi, bhante, bhagavā evamāha, atha kho kāyadaṇḍova mahāsāvajjataro pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyā, no tathā vacīdaṇḍo, no tathā manodaṇḍo”ti.
analyzed: kiñca api bhante bhagavā evam āha atha kho kāya daṇḍaḥ uva mahāsā ajjataraḥ pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyā no tathā vacī daṇḍaḥ no tathā manaḥ daṇḍaḥ iti
translated: “Even though the Blessed One says this, still I think that bodily action is more reprehensible for the performance of bad kamma, for the perpetration of bad kamma, not so much verbal action and mental action.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, gahapati,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi gahapati
translated: “What do you think, householder?

original: idhassa nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto cātuyāmasaṁvarasaṁvuto sabbavārivārito sabbavāriyutto sabbavāridhuto sabbavāriphuṭo.
analyzed: nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa putto cātuyāmasavarasavuto sabba vāri vāritaḥ sabba vāri yuttaḥ sabba vāri dhutaḥ sabba vāri phuṭaḥ
translated: Suppose a naked dog-duty ascetic, restrained in four ways, were to go about totally abstaining from food, totally abstaining from sex, totally abstaining from dancing, singing, music, and going to see shows, and totally abstaining from using garlands, perfumes, and cosmetics.

original: So abhikkamanto paṭikkamanto bahū khuddake pāṇe saṅghātaṁ āpādeti.
analyzed: saḥ abhikkamantaḥ paṭikkamantaḥ bahū khuddake pāṇe saṅghātam āpādeti
translated: As he was going about, he would crush many small living beings.

original: Imassa pana, gahapati, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto kaṁ vipākaṁ paññapetī”ti?
analyzed: imassa pana gahapati nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa putto kam vipākam paññapeti iti
translated: What result would the naked dog-duty ascetic describe for this?”

original: “Asañcetanikaṁ, bhante, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto no mahāsāvajjaṁ paññapetī”ti.
analyzed: asañcetanika bhante nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa putto no mahā sāvajjam paññapeti iti
translated: “Venerable sir, the naked dog-duty ascetic would describe a non-intentional result.”

original: “Sace pana, gahapati, cetetī”ti?
analyzed: sace pana gahapati ceta iti iti
translated: “But if he intends it, householder?”

analyzed: tena hi samma dovārika majjhimāya dvāra sālāya āsanāni paññapehi iti
translated: “Well then, my good gatekeeper, prepare seats in the middle reception hall.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho dovāriko upālissa gahapatissa paṭissutvā majjhimāya dvārasālāya āsanāni paññapetvā yena upāli gahapati tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā upāliṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho dovārikaḥ upālissa gahapatissa paṭissutvā majjhimāya dvāra sālāya āsanāni paññapetvā yena upāli gahapati tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā upālim gahapatim etat avoca
translated: “Yes, sir,” he replied, and he did as asked. He then returned to Upāli and said,

original: “paññattāni kho, bhante, majjhimāya dvārasālāya āsanāni.
analyzed: paññattāni kho bhante majjhimāya dvāra sālāya āsanāni
translated: “Sir, the seats have been prepared in the middle reception hall.

original: Yassadāni kālaṁ maññasī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ sadāni kālam maññasi iti
translated: Please do what you think it’s now time to do.”

original: Atha kho upāli gahapati yena majjhimā dvārasālā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā yaṁ tattha āsanaṁ aggañca seṭṭhañca uttamañca paṇītañca tattha sāmaṁ nisīditvā dovārikaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho upāli gahapati yena majjhimā dvāra sālā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā yam tattha āsanam aggam ca seṭṭham ca uttamam ca paṇītam ca tattha sāmam nisīditvā dovārikam āmantesi
translated: He went to the middle door vestibule, sat down on the best, most excellent, most exquisite seat there, and told the doorman,

original: “tena hi, samma dovārika, yena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā nigaṇṭhaṁ nāṭaputtaṁ evaṁ vadehi:
analyzed: tena hi samma dovārika yena nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa putto tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā nigaṇṭham nāṭa puttam evam vadehi
translated: “Go to the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta and say to him,

original: ‘upāli, bhante, gahapati evamāha—
analyzed: upāli bhante gahapati evam āha
translated: ‘Sir, the householder Upāli says this to you:

original: pavisa kira, bhante, sace ākaṅkhasī’”ti.
analyzed: pavisa kira bhante sace ākaṅkhasi iti
translated: Please enter if you wish.’”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho dovāriko upālissa gahapatissa paṭissutvā yena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā nigaṇṭhaṁ nāṭaputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho dovārikaḥ upālissa gahapatissa paṭissutvā yena nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa putto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā nigaṇṭham nāṭa puttam etat avoca
translated: Responding, “As you say, sir,” to the householder Upāli, the doorman went to the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta and said to him,

original: “upāli, bhante, gahapati evamāha:
analyzed: upāli bhante gahapati evam āha
translated: “Sir, the householder Upāli says this to you:

original: ‘pavisa kira, bhante, sace ākaṅkhasī’”ti.
analyzed: pavisa kira bhante sace ākaṅkhasi iti
translated: Please enter if you wish.”

original: Atha kho nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto mahatiyā nigaṇṭhaparisāya saddhiṁ yena majjhimā dvārasālā tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa puttaḥ mahatiyā nigaṇṭha parisāya saddhim yena majjhimā dvāra sālā tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta, together with a large following of Nigaṇṭhas, went to the middle door vestibule.

original: Atha kho upāli gahapati—
analyzed: atha khalu upāli gahapati
translated: Then Upāli,

original: yaṁ sudaṁ pubbe yato passati nigaṇṭhaṁ nāṭaputtaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ disvāna tato🔽paccuggantvā yaṁ tattha āsanaṁ aggañca seṭṭhañca uttamañca paṇītañca taṁ uttarāsaṅgena
analyzed: yam sudam pubbe yatas passati nigaṇṭham nāṭa puttam dūratas va āgacchantam disvāna tatas  paccuggantvā yam tattha āsanam aggam ca seṭṭham ca uttamam ca paṇītam ca tam uttarāsaṅgena
translated: when he saw the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta coming in the distance,

original: sammajjitvā pariggahetvā nisīdāpeti so—
analyzed: sammajjitvā pariggahetvā nisīdāpeti saḥ
translated: he went out to meet him, and he took the best seat there, the most prominent, the highest, the most luxurious, and after dusting it with his robe, he motioned for him to sit down.

original: dāni yaṁ tattha āsanaṁ aggañca seṭṭhañca uttamañca paṇītañca tattha sāmaṁ nisīditvā nigaṇṭhaṁ nāṭaputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: dāni yam tattha āsanam aggam ca seṭṭham ca uttamam ca paṇītam ca tattha sāmam nisīditvā nigaṇṭham nāṭa puttam etat avoca
translated: But now, when he saw the best seat there, the most prominent, the highest, the most luxurious, he sat down right there, and he said to the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta,

original: “saṁvijjanti kho, bhante, āsanāni;
analyzed: savijjanti kho bhante āsanāni
translated: “There are seats, venerable sirs.

original: sace ākaṅkhasi, nisīdā”ti.
analyzed: sace ākaṅkhasi nisīdāti
translated: If you wish, you may sit down.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto upāliṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa puttaḥ upālim gahapatim etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta said to Upāli,

original: “ummattosi tvaṁ, gahapati, dattosi tvaṁ, gahapati.
analyzed: ummattā asi tva gahapati dattā usi tva gahapati
translated: “Are you mad, householder? Are you possessed?

original: ‘Gacchāmahaṁ, bhante, samaṇassa gotamassa vādaṁ āropessāmī’ti gantvā mahatāsi vādasaṅghāṭena paṭimukko āgato.
analyzed: gacchāmaha bhante samaṇassa gotamassa vādam āropessāmi iti gantvā mahatā asi vāda saṅghāṭena paṭimukkaḥ āgataḥ
translated: ‘I’m going, venerable sirs, to refute the recluse Gotama’s doctrine.’ But after going, you’ve come back defeated, with your head lowered, taking the wrong road, confused and lost, and you’ve fallen into an abyss.”

original: Seyyathāpi, gahapati, puriso aṇḍahārako gantvā ubbhatehi aṇḍehi āgaccheyya, seyyathā vā pana gahapati puriso akkhikahārako gantvā ubbhatehi akkhīhi āgaccheyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api gahapati purisaḥ aṇḍa hārakaḥ gantvā ubbhatehi aṇḍehi āgaccheyya seyyathā vā pana gahapati purisaḥ akkhika hārakaḥ gantvā ubbhatehi akkhīhi āgaccheyya
translated: Just as if a man were to go on a journey carrying his provisions in a basket, and he were to come back having used up all his provisions and also having used up the basket,

original: evameva kho tvaṁ, gahapati, ‘gacchāmahaṁ, bhante, samaṇassa gotamassa vādaṁ āropessāmī’ti gantvā mahatāsi vādasaṅghāṭena paṭimukko āgato.
analyzed: evam eva kho tva gahapati gacchāmaha bhante samaṇassa gotamassa vādam āropessāmi iti gantvā mahatā asi vāda saṅghāṭena paṭimukkaḥ āgataḥ
translated: so too, householder, you went thinking, ‘I will refute the recluse Gotama’s doctrine and conduct,’ but you have come back having been refuted by the recluse Gotama and turned back by him.

original: Āvaṭṭosi kho tvaṁ, gahapati, samaṇena gotamena āvaṭṭaniyā māyāyā”ti.
analyzed: āvaṭṭaḥ asi kho tva gahapati samaṇena gotamena āvaṭṭaniyā māyāyā ati
translated: You have been turned back by the recluse Gotama with his turning back magic.”

original: “Bhaddikā, bhante, āvaṭṭanī māyā;
analyzed: bhaddikā bhante āvaṭṭanī māyā
translated: “Venerable sir, the turning back magic is good,

original: kalyāṇī, bhante, āvaṭṭanī māyā;
analyzed: kalyāṇī bhante āvaṭṭanī māyā
translated: the turning back magic is excellent,

original: piyā me, bhante, ñātisālohitā imāya āvaṭṭaniyā āvaṭṭeyyuṁ; piyānampi me assa ñātisālohitānaṁ dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāya;
analyzed: piyāḥ me bhante ñāti sālohitāḥ imāya āvaṭṭaniyāḥ āvaṭṭeyyu piyānam pi me assa ñāti sālohitānam dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya
translated: and if my dear and beloved relatives were to be turned back by it, it would lead to the welfare and happiness of my dear and beloved relatives for a long time.

original: sabbe cepi, bhante, khattiyā imāya āvaṭṭaniyā āvaṭṭeyyuṁ; sabbesānampissa khattiyānaṁ
analyzed: sabbe ce ipi bhante khattiyāḥ imāya āvaṭṭaniyāḥ āvaṭṭeyyu sabbesānam pissa
translated: And if all nobles were to be turned back by it, it would lead to the welfare and happiness of all nobles for a long time.

original: dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāya; sabbe cepi, bhante, brāhmaṇā …pe… vessā …pe… suddā imāya
analyzed: dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya sabbe ce pi bhante brāhmaṇāḥ pe vessāḥ pe suddāḥ imāya
translated: If all the brahmins … all the merchants … all the workers

original: āvaṭṭaniyā āvaṭṭeyyuṁ; sabbesānampissa suddānaṁ dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāya;
analyzed: āvaṭṭaniyāḥ āvaṭṭeyyu sabbesānam pissa suddānam dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya
translated: were to be converted by this conversion, it would lead to the welfare and happiness of all the workers for a long time.

original: sadevako cepi, bhante, loko samārako sabrahmako sassamaṇabrāhmaṇī pajā sadevamanussā🔽imāya āvaṭṭaniyā āvaṭṭeyyuṁ; sadevakassapissa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā
analyzed: sa devakaḥ ce pi bhante lokaḥ sa mārakaḥ sa brahmakaḥ sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇī pajā sa deva manussā  imāya āvaṭṭaniyā āvaṭṭeyyu sa devakassa pissa lokassa sa mārakassa sa brahmakassa sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā
translated: If the world with its gods, lords of death, and supreme beings, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans,

original: pajāya sadevamanussāya dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyāti.
analyzed: pajāya sa deva manussāya dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: were to be converted by this conversion, it would lead to the welfare and happiness of the world with its gods, lords of death, and supreme beings, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans, for a long time.”

original: Tena hi, bhante, upamaṁ te karissāmi.
analyzed: tena hi bhante upamam te karissāmi
translated: “In that case, venerable sir, I will use a simile for you,

original: Upamāyapidhekacce viññū purisā bhāsitassa atthaṁ ājānanti.
analyzed: viññū purisāḥ bhāsitassa attham ājānanti
translated: for some wise people understand the meaning of a statement by means of a simile.

original: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhante, aññatarassa brāhmaṇassa jiṇṇassa vuḍḍhassa mahallakassa daharā māṇavikā pajāpatī ahosi gabbhinī upavijaññā.
analyzed: bhūta pubba bhante aññatarassa brāhmaṇassa jiṇṇassa vuḍḍhassa mahallakassa daharā māṇavikā pajāpatī ahosi gabbhinī upavijaññā
translated: Once there was an old brahmin who was aged, advanced in years, and at the final stage of his life. He had a young wife who was pregnant and soon to give birth.

original: Atha kho, bhante, sā māṇavikā taṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca,
analyzed: atha khalu bhante sā māṇavikā tam brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: Then the young wife said to the brahmin:

original: ‘gaccha tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, āpaṇā makkaṭacchāpakaṁ kiṇitvā ānehi, yo me kumārakassa kīḷāpanako bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: gaccha tva brāhmaṇaḥ āpaṇa makkaṭa chāpakam kiṇitvā ānehi yaḥ me kumārakassa kīḷāpanakaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: ‘Go to the market, brahmin, and buy a young monkey for me. It will be a playmate for my child.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, so brāhmaṇo taṁ māṇavikaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tam māṇavikam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the brahmin said to the student’s wife:

original: ‘āgamehi tāva, bhoti, yāva vijāyati.
analyzed: tāva bhoti yāva vijāyati
translated: ‘Wait, Madam, until you give birth.

original: Sace tvaṁ, bhoti, kumārakaṁ vijāyissasi, tassā te ahaṁ āpaṇā makkaṭacchāpakaṁ kiṇitvā ānessāmi, yo te kumārakassa kīḷāpanako bhavissati.
analyzed: sace tva bhoti kumārakam vijāyissasi tassā te aham āpaṇā makkaṭa chāpakam kiṇitvā ānessāmi yaḥ te kumārakassa kīḷāpanakaḥ bhavissati
translated: If you give birth to a boy, I will go to the market and buy a young male monkey for you, to be a playmate for your boy.

original: Sace pana tvaṁ, bhoti, kumārikaṁ vijāyissasi, tassā te ahaṁ āpaṇā makkaṭacchāpikaṁ kiṇitvā ānessāmi, yā te kumārikāya kīḷāpanikā bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: sace pana tva bhoti kumārikam vijāyissasi tassā te aham āpaṇā makkaṭa chāpikam kiṇitvā ānessāmi yā te kumārikāya kīḷāpanikā bhavissati iti
translated: But if you give birth to a girl, I will go to the market and buy a young female monkey for you, to be a playmate for your girl.’

original: Dutiyampi kho, bhante, sā māṇavikā …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho bhante sā māṇavikā pe
translated: For a second time, the student’s wife said to the brahmin:

original: tatiyampi kho, bhante, sā māṇavikā taṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho bhante sā māṇavikā tam brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: For a third time, she said to him:

original: ‘gaccha tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, āpaṇā makkaṭacchāpakaṁ kiṇitvā ānehi, yo me kumārakassa kīḷāpanako bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: gaccha tva brāhmaṇaḥ āpaṇa makkaṭa chāpakam kiṇitvā ānehi yaḥ me kumārakassa kīḷāpanakaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: ‘Go to the market, brahmin, and buy a young monkey for me. It will be a playmate for my child.’

original: Atha kho, bhante, so brāhmaṇo tassā māṇavikāya sāratto paṭibaddhacitto āpaṇā makkaṭacchāpakaṁ kiṇitvā ānetvā taṁ māṇavikaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho bhante saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tassā māṇavikāya sārattaḥ paṭibaddha cittaḥ āpaṇā makkaṭa chāpakam kiṇitvā ānetvā tam māṇavikam etat avoca
translated: Then, reverend Sir, that brahmin, being infatuated with that student’s wife, and with his mind bound to her, after buying a monkey’s skin in the market, bringing it, said this to that student’s wife:

original: ‘ayaṁ te, bhoti, āpaṇā makkaṭacchāpako kiṇitvā ānīto, yo te kumārakassa kīḷāpanako bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: ayam te bhoti āpaṇā makkaṭa chāpakaḥ kiṇitvā ānītaḥ yaḥ te kumārakassa kīḷāpanakaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: ‘This, my dear, is a monkey’s skin bought in the market, which will be a toy for your boy.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, bhante, sā māṇavikā taṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte bhante sā māṇavikā tam brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: After that was said, reverend Sir, that student’s wife said this to that brahmin:

original: ‘gaccha tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, imaṁ makkaṭacchāpakaṁ ādāya yena rattapāṇi rajakaputto tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇiṁ rajakaputtaṁ evaṁ vadehi—
analyzed: gaccha tva brāhmaṇaḥ imam makkaṭa chāpakam ādāya yena rattapāṇiḥ rajaka putto tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇim rajaka puttam evam vadehi
translated: ‘Go, brahmin, taking this monkey’s skin, and after approaching Rattapāṇi the laundryman, and saying this to Rattapāṇi the laundryman—

original: icchāmahaṁ, samma rattapāṇi, imaṁ makkaṭacchāpakaṁ pītāvalepanaṁ nāma raṅgajātaṁ rajitaṁ ākoṭitapaccākoṭitaṁ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhan’ti.
analyzed: icchāmaha samma ratta pāṇi imam makkaṭacchāpakam pītāvalepanam nāma raṅga jātam rajitam ākoṭita paccākoṭitam ubhatobhāga vimaṭṭhanti
translated: “I want, dear Rattapāṇi, this monkey’s skin to be dyed with the yellow dye called pītāvalepana, and to be beaten and re-beaten, and to be well-cleaned on both sides.”’

original: Atha kho, bhante, so brāhmaṇo tassā māṇavikāya sāratto paṭibaddhacitto taṁ makkaṭacchāpakaṁ
analyzed: atha kho bhante saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tassā māṇavikāya sārattaḥ paṭibaddha cittaḥ tam makkaṭa chāpaka
translated: Then, reverend Sir, that brahmin, being infatuated with that student’s wife, and with his mind bound to her, after taking that monkey’s skin,🔽approached Rattapāṇi the laundryman, and after approaching he said this to Rattapāṇi the laundryman:

original: ādāya yena rattapāṇi rajakaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇiṁ rajakaputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ādāya yena rattapāṇiḥ rajaka putto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇim rajaka puttam etat avoca
translated: and went to the dye-maker Ratthapala. He said to him:

original: ‘icchāmahaṁ, samma rattapāṇi, imaṁ makkaṭacchāpakaṁ pītāvalepanaṁ nāma raṅgajātaṁ rajitaṁ ākoṭitapaccākoṭitaṁ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhan’ti.
analyzed: icchāmaha samma ratta pāṇi imam makkaṭacchāpakam pītāvalepanam nāma raṅga jātam rajitam ākoṭita paccākoṭitam ubhatobhāga vimaṭṭhanti
translated: ‘My good Ratthapala, I want to dye this monkey-skin with yellow dye.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, bhante, rattapāṇi rajakaputto taṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte bhante rattapāṇi rajaka putto tam brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: When he had said this, Ratthapala replied:

original: ‘ayaṁ kho te, bhante, makkaṭacchāpako raṅgakkhamo hi kho, no ākoṭanakkhamo, no vimajjanakkhamo’ti.
analyzed: ayam kho te bhante makkaṭa chāpakaḥ raṅga kkhamaḥ hi kho no ākoṭana khamaḥ no vimajjana kkhamaḥ iti
translated: ‘Sir, this monkey-skin is suitable for dyeing, but not for beating or rubbing down.’

original: Evameva kho, bhante, bālānaṁ nigaṇṭhānaṁ vādo raṅgakkhamo hi kho bālānaṁ no paṇḍitānaṁ, no anuyogakkhamo, no vimajjanakkhamo.🔽Atha kho, bhante, so brāhmaṇo aparena samayena navaṁ dussayugaṁ ādāya yena rattapāṇi rajakaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇiṁ rajakaputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam eva kho bhante bālānam nigaṇṭhānam vādaḥ raṅga kkhamaḥ hi kho bālānam no paṇḍitāna no anuyoga kkhamaḥ no vimajjana kkhamaḥ 🔽atha khalu bhante saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ aparena samayena navam dussa yugam ādāya yena rattapāṇiḥ rajaka putto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇim rajaka puttam etat avoca
translated: In the same way, the doctrine of the foolish Niganthas is suitable for the foolish, but not for the wise, and it cannot bear scrutiny when questioned and cross-questioned.

original: ‘icchāmahaṁ, samma rattapāṇi, imaṁ navaṁ dussayugaṁ pītāvalepanaṁ nāma raṅgajātaṁ rajitaṁ ākoṭitapaccākoṭitaṁ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhan’ti.
analyzed: icchāmaha samma rattapāṇi imam navam dussa yugam pītāvalepanam nāma raṅga jātam rajitam ākoṭita paccākoṭitam ubhatobhāga vimaṭṭhanti
translated: ‘I want to dye this new pair of cloths with the yellow dye called “golden showers”.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, bhante, rattapāṇi rajakaputto taṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte bhante rattapāṇi rajaka putto tam brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: When that was said, the dye-master Ratthapāla replied to the brahmin:

original: ‘idaṁ kho te, bhante, navaṁ dussayugaṁ raṅgakkhamañceva ākoṭanakkhamañca vimajjanakkhamañcā’ti.

original: Evameva kho, bhante, tassa bhagavato vādo arahato sammāsambuddhassa raṅgakkhamo ceva paṇḍitānaṁ no bālānaṁ, anuyogakkhamo ca vimajjanakkhamo cā”ti.🔽“Sarājikā kho, gahapati, parisā evaṁ jānāti:
analyzed: evam eva kho bhante tassa bhagavataḥ vādaḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa raṅga kkhamaḥ ca iva paṇḍitānam no bālānam anuyoga kkhamaḥ ca vimajjana kkhamaḥ ca ati  sa rājikā khalu gahapati parisā evam jānāti
translated: In the same way, sir, the speech of the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, is suitable for dyeing and for beating, and it is smooth on both sides.”

original: ‘upāli gahapati nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa sāvako’ti.

original: “Seyyathāpi, bhante, nānāpupphānaṁ mahāpuppharāsi, tamenaṁ dakkho mālākāro vā mālākārantevāsī vā vicittaṁ mālaṁ gantheyya;

translated: “Just as a skilled garland-maker or garland-maker’s apprentice might string together a garland of various flowers,

translated: Then, unable to bear the Blessed One’s honor and praise, hot blood gushed from the mouth of the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta and he died.
